post.title: Violent Organized Crime: What Rio de Janeiro Can Learn from the Experiences of Medellín and San Salvador
post.excerpt: Instituto 12 and Leme – Laboratory for Violence Reduction Host Four of the World’s Leading Experts in Organized Crime and Public Security Policies in Latin America
post.content:
Instituto 12 and Leme – Laboratory for Violence Reduction Host Four of the World’s Leading Experts in Organized Crime and Public Security Policies in Latin America.

During the event, Joana Monteiro – Director of Leme – will interview Chris Blattman (University of Chicago), Benjamin Lessing (University of Chicago), and Carlos Schmidt-Padilla (UC Berkeley), internationally recognized experts in research on violence, organized crime, and governance in high-crime contexts.

The discussion will cover topics such as:

  • What science already knows about reducing the power and violence of organized crime.

  • Successful experiences and the lessons they offer for the Brazilian context.

  • Paths to rethink public security in Rio de Janeiro and the region.

A unique opportunity for academics, policymakers, journalists, and citizens interested in understanding, based on evidence, how to address one of the greatest challenges facing our city and Latin America.
